snippet: State Senator Malcolm A. Smith is charged with taking part in a conspiracy to pass $60,000 in bribes to Daniel J. Halloran III, then a city councilman, and two Republican county leaders.
abstract: Secretly recorded conversations are played at bribery trial of New York State Sen Malcolm A Smith; he is charged with taking part in a conspiracy to pass $60,000 in bribes to Daniel J Halloran III, then a city councilman, and two Republican county leaders, in attempt to get on New York City ballot in 2013 mayoral race.
lead_paragraph: State Senator Malcolm A. Smith is charged with taking part in a conspiracy to pass $60,000 in bribes to Daniel J. Halloran III, then a city councilman, and two Republican county leaders.

headline.main: On Trial’s Tapes, Talk of New York Politics, Secret Cash and Strip Clubs
headline.print_headline: On Trial’s Tapes, Talk of Politics, Secret Cash and Strip Clubs

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
